2015? | label = | associated_acts = [[Rats & Star]] | website = [https://web.archive.org/web/20081006084927/http://tashiromasashi.com/ www.tashiromasashi.com] }} {{nihongo|'''Masashi Tashiro'''|田代 まさし|Tashiro Masashi|extra=real name pronounced the same, but written as 田代 政}} (born August 31, 1956) is a former [[Japanese people|Japanese]] [[television]] performer and the founding member of the [[band (music)|band]] [[Rats & Star]]. Tashiro was a [[tenor]] vocalist for Rats & Star, and later on made himself a name as a TV entertainer in Japan. He also directed a [[film|movie]] after his band broke up. His arrest for looking up a woman's skirt in September 2000 marked the beginning of Tashiro's problems with the law. == Early life == Masashi Tashiro was born in [[Saga Prefecture]] on August 31, 1956. His father, a manager of a [[cabaret]] chain, ran away with another woman. Subsequently, his parents divorced and he was raised solely by his mother. In 1961, when Tashiro was six years old, he and his mother moved to [[Tokyo]] and he entered missionary [[kindergarten]]. In 1963, he enrolled at Toyama [[elementary school]] in [[Shinjuku, Tokyo|Shinjuku]]. At age thirteen, while a student at Okubo [[junior high school]], his mother remarried and he chose to enroll in a higher grade at a private [[high school]] and live with his father in order not to rely financially on his mother's new husband. In 1972, he entered Machine Studies at Shibaura Institute of Technology Senior High School after graduating from Nakase junior high school in March of the same year. At Shibaura, he met [[Masayuki Suzuki]]. They later formed the band The [[Rats & Star|Chanels]]. Tashiro and Suzuki were then considered [[juvenile delinquent]]s. He was allegedly involved in fights, [[Bōsōzoku|motorcycle gang]] problems, going to party at a [[disco]] and going [[nanpa|girl-hunting]] every day during his time at high school. He has been detained by the police because of [[assault]]. He met his present wife at the end of his first year at high school. (However, he and his wife are now separated because of his several [[scandal]]s and [[imprisonment]]) In March 1975, he graduated from Shibaura Institute of Technology Senior High School. It was around this time he started driving. His first car was a [[Nissan Sunny|Sunny]]. His subsequent cars were a [[Nissan Gloria|Gloria]], a [[Chevrolet Camaro|Camaro]], a [[Ford]], a [[Honda Prelude|Prelude]], and a [[Mercedes-Benz]]. It had grown into an obsession of his. After graduating from Shibaura Institute of Technology Senior High School in March 1975, centering [[Masayuki Suzuki]], the Japanese [[doo-wop]] band The Chanels was formed with Tashiro, [[Nobuyoshi Kuwano]] and others in the same year. Suzuki was the lead singer, Kuwano was the [[trumpeter]], and he sang baritone. In June 1975, he ran away from home after getting into a big row with his father. Later, he was taken in by Chanels member Hiroyuki Kuboki and worked as a [[clerk (position)|clerk]] for the same [[filling station]]. He had lived in the company's dormitory for two years. Afterwards, he became a [[trucker]] after he was hired by the president of a truck company, who came as a customer in Tashiro's filling station in 1978. Although he already formed the band, he allegedly kept on working as a trucker because he thought that "''The entertainment world is scary''". == Success == === The Chanels and Rats & Star === The Chanels were formed in 1975, and began performing as an amateur band in 1976. They were chosen as a No. 1 band on a Japanese television program called {{nihongo|"''Ginza Now''"|ギンザNOW}} and won a prize in a music contest under the sponsorship of [[Yamaha (manufacturer)|Yamaha]]. Tashiro made his debut as a member of the group in 1980 and they came to be widely known for adopting [[rhythm and blues]] style. 4 members of the front singers including Tashiro wore [[blackface]] using [[shoe polish]] and they became famous and popular. Their first single, "''Runaway''" sold more than 1 million copies. Their May 1981's single "''Hurricane''" was covered by [[Puffy AmiYumi]] in 2001. In 1983, the group changed its name to [[Rats & Star]] because of its similarity with the [[france|French]] brand [[Chanel]]. The band practically dissolved in 1986 because the leader Suzuki launched a solo single, {{nihongo|"The Summer Disappeared Over the Glass"|ガラス越しに消えた夏|Garasu goshi ni kieta natsu}}. Tashiro, appeared on TV music shows like "''The Best Ten''" (ザ・ベストテン) and worked as a [[lyricist]] for singer and actress [[Kyōko Koizumi]], gaining enough popularity in Japan that he released an [[gramophone record|LP]], {{nihongo|"The Legend of [[Niijima]]"|新島の伝説|Niijima no densetsu}} as a solo artist. In March 1996, Rats & Star's members got together for six months and covered a member of band [[Happy End (band)|Happy End]] [[Eiichi Otaki]]'s song {{nihongo|"''If I Could Meet You in a Dream''"|夢で逢えたら|Yume de Aetara}} in April of the same year. This song recorded a big hit. They also appeared in [[NHK]]'s [[Kōhaku Uta Gassen]] at [[New Year's Eve]] of the year. === Comedian === After Rats & Star broke up, his comedic talent was discovered by [[Ken Shimura]], a member of Japanese comedic group ''[[The Drifters (Japanese band)|The Drifters]]'', and he became a [[owarai|television comedian]]. Here he gained the [[nickname]]s {{nihongo|"King of [[pun]]"|ダジャレの帝王|Dajare no Teiō}} and {{nihongo|"Genius of [[Theatrical properties|props]]"|小道具の天才|Kodōgu no Tensai}}. On July 10, 1988, he opened a ''[[tarento]]'' shop, called "Marcy's" (マーシーズ) after his nickname, in [[Takeshita Street]], [[Shibuya, Tokyo|Shibuya]], Tokyo. He appeared in many [[television commercial]]s, hosted in many television programs, wrote an autobiography and a book on puns, directed a movie and starred as the main character in the [[Nintendo Entertainment System|Famicom]]/[[MSX2]] [[action game]] {{nihongo|"''[[Tashiro Masashi no Princess ga Ippai|Masashi Tashiro Has So Many Princesses]]''"|田代まさしのプリンセスがいっぱい|Tashiro Masashi no purinsesu ga ippai}}, released in Japan on October 27, 1989. This video game was not successful at the time it was published. However, after his later scandals and arrests, it started to fetch very high prices on [[online auction business model|Internet auctions]] like [[Yahoo!]]. He also appeared as a [[film actor]] in a Shizuka Ijuin's original work film "Crêpe" in October, 1993. He co-starred with an actress [[Kaho Minami]] ([[Ken Watanabe]]'s present wife). == Voyeurism incident == On September 24, 2000, he was sent to the [[prosecutor]]'s office for filming up a woman's [[skirt]] with a [[camcorder]] in [[Tokyu Toyoko Line]] [[Toritsudaigaku Station]] in [[Meguro]], Tokyo. When he was asked why he had done it at a [[news conference]] on October 4 of the same year, he claimed that he had been producing a comic film called {{nihongo|"Mini ni tako ga dekiru"|ミニにタコができる}}, a [[pun]] on the similar Japanese pronunciations for {{nihongo|"mini"|ミニ||, miniskirt}} and {{nihongo|"mimi"|耳||, ear}} and the two meanings of "tako" ([[callus]] and octopus) based on the [[Japanese language|Japanese]] saying {{nihongo|"mimi ni tako ga dekiru"|耳にタコができる||, literally "I have a callus in my ear [from hearing something so often]"}}. The "''mini ni tako''" remark became infamous in the Japanese [[news media]]. In December 2000, he was fined 50,000 [[yen]] (about 430 USD) for the voyeurism.{{cite news|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2001/12/29/national/tv-comedian-indicted-over-drug-use/#.VZ--APntlBc|title=TV comedian indicted over drug use|publisher=The Japan Times|date=2001-12-29|accessdate=2008-07-15}} He was barred from working in the entertainment industry temporarily by his entertainment agency, MTM Productions, and his comment was "I wish miniskirts were obliterated from the Earth." While he was barred, he did volunteer work such as carrying the wash and serving meals in a nursing home 3 days a week. On June 28, 2001, he announced his return to the entertainment world by saying, {{nihongo|"Please give Masashi Tashiro one more chance."|もう1度だけ田代まさしを、よろしくお願い致します}} In July 2001 he appeared as a guest on television programs such as "''[[Downtown (owarai)|Downtown]] DX''," {{nihongo|"''Guruguru [[Ninety-Nine (owarai)|Ninety-Nine]]''"|ぐるぐるナインティナイン}} and {{nihongo|"''[[Mecha-Mecha Iketeru!]]''"|めちゃ2イケてるッ!}}. He also returned as part of the regular cast in {{nihongo|"''[[Ken Shimura|Shimura Ken]] no Bakatono-sama''"|志村けんのバカ殿様}}. In order to become a regular in another program, {{nihongo|"''HAMADA COMPANY Dangan! Heroes''"|HAMADA COMPANY 弾丸!ヒーローズ}}, he was challenged to travel from Tokyo to [[Okinawa]] without being discovered by anyone. He lost the contest when he was found out in [[Kyoto]] and 100 pictures of him were taken, but the public liked his stunt and his popularity soared back. On July 6, 2015, Tashiro was sent to the prosecutor's office for filming up a woman's skirt with his [[mobile phone]] in [[Tōkyū Den-en-toshi Line]] [[Futako-Tamagawa Station]] in [[Setagaya]], Tokyo.[http://news.tbs.co.jp/newseye/tbs_newseye2537218.html 田代まさしさん、スカート内を盗撮容疑で書類送検へ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710050046/http://news.tbs.co.jp/newseye/tbs_newseye2537218.html |date=2015-07-10 }}[http://www.jiji.com/jc/zc?k=201507/2015071000594&g=soc 田代まさしさん書類送検へ＝駅で女性を盗撮容疑－警視庁]{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}[http://jp.reuters.com/article/kyodoNationalNews/idJP2015071001001771 田代まさしさん盗撮の疑い] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711004242/http://jp.reuters.com/article/kyodoNationalNews/idJP2015071001001771 |date=2015-07-11 }} == First trial for drug use == On December 9, 2001, he was arrested for peeping through the bathroom window of a man's house near his home in Kita-senzoku, Ōta, Tokyo by [[Den-en-chōfu]] [[police]].{{cite news|url=http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/04/20011210i406.htm|archive-url=https://archive.is/20011217224319/http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/04/20011210i406.htm|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2001-12-17|script-title=ja:田代まさし容疑者、ふろ場のぞいたとして逮捕|publisher=[[Yomiuri Shimbun]]|date=2001-12-10|accessdate=2008-07-15|language=ja}} According to the police, the 32-year-old man who was being spied spotted Tashiro and ran after him for 300 meters wearing only a bath [[towel]] around his waist, eventually catching him and delivering him to the station. An [[Witness|eyewitness]] reported that Tashiro put on a [[cap]] like a [[ski]] cap, spoke loudly {{nihongo|"Forgive me"|許してくれ|yurushitekure}}, {{nihongo|"It was a misunderstanding"|勘違いだ|kanchigai da}} when he was caught and there was a camcorder in the vicinity of the scene recording. He was released on bail without punishment.{{cite news|url=http://www.asahi.com/national/update/1211/040.html|script-title=ja:自宅から覚せい剤、のぞきの田代まさし容疑者を再逮捕|publisher=[[Asahi Shimbun]]|date=2001-12-11|accessdate=2008-07-15|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20011212000932/http://www.asahi.com/national/update/1211/040.html|archivedate=2001-12-12|language=ja}} However, he was arrested for possession and use of [[amphetamine]] on December 12, 2001.{{cite news|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2002/02/19/national/comedian-avoids-prison-time-for-drug-use/#.VZ--f_ntlBc|title=Comedian avoids prison time for drug use|publisher=The Japan Times|date=2002-02-19|accessdate=2008-07-15}} The seven [[detective|police detectives]] carried out a home search in Tashiro's house as a corroborative investigation into his [[Voyeurism|Peeping Tom]] incident and discovered a bag containing 0.4 ~ 0.9g of [[amphetamine|speed]]. Tashiro stated that, "I bought it", but how he used it was unknown because a [[syringe]] used to inject drugs was not discovered in the home search. He was detained as a suspect at the police station after his arrest until February 1 of the next year. As a result, he was dismissed by MTM Production on the same day because of the repeated scandals. On December 28, 2001, he was prosecuted for the violation of Stimulant Drugs Control Law. He testified that, "I used drugs to get rid of stress and tension before appearing on a TV program" for the investigation by [[Tokyo District Prosecution Office]]. He also said, "I lived confined to the house and I began to worry. From about this April, I used it once every few days". According to an indictment, he warmed amphetamine over a fire and absorbed it in his home's video room. His first trial for drug use and other crimes was in [[Tokyo District Court]] on February 1, 2002. Judgement was given on the case in the same court on February 8, 2002, where he was found guilty. However, he was given 3 years [[suspended sentence]] of 2 years imprisonment. In [[spring (season)|spring]] 2002, he returned to the entertainment world as director of [[V-Cinema]] series such as {{nihongo|"''The Way of the Whales''"|鯨道|kujira-michi}}. In 2003 he made a recorded guest appearance in [[Tokyo Broadcasting System|TBS]]'s {{nihongo|"''Sunday Japon''"|サンデージャポン|sandē japon}} on [[New Year's Eve]]. This is his last public appearance in a television program to date. == Car accident == There was a rumor that Tashiro would be coming back to the public screens in spring 2004. However, he once again found himself in legal trouble for causing a [[car accident]] on the [[Ōme, Tokyo|Ōme]] road in [[Suginami, Tokyo|Suginami]]. According to news reports, at about 1 AM on June 16, 2004, he crashed into an 18-year-old [[vocational school]] student on a [[motorcycle]] after making an illegal [[U-turn (maneuver)|U-turn]].{{cite news|url=http://www.asahi.com/national/update/0617/007.html|script-title=ja:田代まさしさんが人身事故　禁止場所でＵターン、衝突|language=Japanese|publisher=Asahi Shimbun|date=2004-06-17|accessdate=2008-07-15|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040619005918/http://www.asahi.com/national/update/0617/007.html|archivedate=2004-06-19}} The victim had his left thigh broken and suffered an injury that would take 2 years to heal completely. == Second trial for drug use == After 10 p.m. of September 20, 2004, he was arrested for violation of the Firearms and Swords Control Law in a street in [[Nakano, Tokyo|Nakano]] because he had a [[butterfly knife]] with a blade 8 centimeters long.{{cite web|url=http://headlines.yahoo.co.jp/hl?a=20040921-00000288-jij-soci|script-title=ja:田代まさし容疑者を逮捕＝リュックに覚せい剤、大麻－警視庁|language=Japanese|publisher=[[Yahoo! Japan]]|date=2004-09-21|accessdate=2008-07-15|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040925154544/http://headlines.yahoo.co.jp/hl?a=20040921-00000288-jij-soci|archivedate=2004-09-25}} He shared his car on the street with a female acquaintance then and the police questioned them. After the investigation, it was also found out that he had about 2g of amphetamines and about 4g of [[cannabis (drug)|marijuana]] in a rucksack. As a result, he was once again arrested for it on the evening of the next day because a woman with him said "''This rucksack is his''" and he admitted it, too. After this incident, former Rats & Star member Masayuki Suzuki apologized for Tashiro's crimes in his place.{{cite news|url=http://www.zakzak.co.jp/gei/2004_09/g2004092109.html|script-title=ja:田代まさし逮捕、車に同乗女は覚せい剤＆大麻|publisher=Zakzak|language=Japanese|date=2004-09-21|accessdate=2008-07-15}} Tashiro stated that the pressure of stardom contributed to his addiction to drugs. Following this arrest, Tashiro was harshly criticized by many of his former co-workers, who said: {{quotation|We want him to get out from the entertainment world because what he did was despicable|Cha Katou, [[Ken Shimura]], [[Masayuki Suzuki]], Yoshio Sato, [[Nobuyoshi Kuwano]]}} {{quotation|The damned fool! I'd like to slap him!|[[Kenichi Mikawa]]{{cite news|url=http://www.sanspo.com/geino/top/gt200409/gt2004092303.html|script-title=ja:美川憲一、号泣…体験思い出し田代まさしを厳しく叱責|language=Japanese|publisher=[[Sankei Sports]]|date=2004-09-23|accessdate=2008-07-15|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040925024217/http://www.sanspo.com/geino/top/gt200409/gt2004092303.html|archivedate=2004-09-25}}}} {{quotation|I don't want to be associated with such a man.|[[Takeshi Kitano]]}} He was virtually retired from the entertainment world and was treated like he never existed. From here on, the media would refer to him as the "former [[tarento|entertainer]]", and all the recordings and pictures taken when he was a Chanels/Rats & Star member were almost never broadcast anymore, and if they were, Tashiro's voice would be lowered to a hush or removed entirely, and no part of his body would show. Newspapers and magazines tacitly agreed not to talk about him at all. In an episode of a comedic duo {{nihongo|[[Bakusho Mondai]]|爆笑問題|Bakushō Mondai}}, host [[Hikari Ota]] accidentally said his full name. In {{nihongo|''The God of Entertainment''|エンタの神様|enta no kami-sama}}, [[Sayaka Aoki (comedian)|Sayaka Aoki]], while displaying only part of his name, said "I put a camera in the chest drawer", which caused a general laugh. On the other hand, the part of Ken Shimura's commemorative speech held for the release of his program on [[DVD]] where he said "Have you disappeared like [[Takafumi Horie]] when you were knocked-out? I wanted to release this five years ago" was not broadcast. He was arrested for possession of amphetamines on September 21, 2004. On February 7, 2005, he was sentenced to 3 years and 6 months imprisonment.{{cite news|url=http://www.asahi.com/national/update/0207/024.html|script-title=ja:田代まさし被告に懲役３年６カ月の実刑判決　東京地裁|language=Japanese|publisher=Asahi Shimbun|date=2005-02-07|accessdate=2008-07-15|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050209042854/http://www.asahi.com/national/update/0207/024.html|archivedate=2005-02-09}} On June 26, 2008, he was released from the prison.{{cite news|url=http://mainichi.jp/enta/geinou/news/20080708spn00m200019000c.html|script-title=ja:マーシー：出所　３年半の獄中生活を語る|language=Japanese|publisher=[[Mainichi Shimbun]]|date=2008-07-08|accessdate=2008-07-15|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120710144120/http://mainichi.jp/enta/geinou/news/20080708spn00m200019000c.html|archivedate=2012-07-10|df=}} {{cite web|url=http://sankei.jp.msn.com/affairs/crime/080708/crm0807080758004-n1.htm |script-title=ja:田代まさしさん出所していた！雑誌で独占告白も |language=Japanese |publisher=[[Sankei Shimbun]] |date=2008-07-08 |accessdate=2008-07-15 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080713224135/http://sankei.jp.msn.com/affairs/crime/080708/crm0807080758004-n1.htm |archivedate=2008-07-13 |deadurl=yes |df= }} == Cocaine incident == On September 16, 2010, he was arrested along with a 50-year-old woman in a parking lot in [[Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse|Red Brick Park]] in [[Yokohama]], Japan for possession of [[cocaine]]. According to police he was in possession of two bags of cocaine, and admitted "It is for my own use".in Japanese: (自分で使うために持っていた)[http://megalodon.jp/2010-0916-1758-30/www.tv-asahi.co.jp/ann/news/web/html/200916023.html 髪薄く、頬こけげっそり…逮捕の田代まさし容疑者]{{ja icon}} When the police guarded against Yokohama because of [[APEC Japan 2010]], he and a 50-year-old woman were arrested. Tashiro said he bought cocaine from a [[disc jockey|DJ]].{{cite web|url=http://megalodon.jp/2010-0917-1431-54/mdn.mainichi.jp/mdnnews/news/20100916p2a00m0na020000c.html |title=Celebrity Masashi Tashiro arrested for cocaine possession |publisher=Megalodon.jp |date= |accessdate=2013-01-04}}[http://megalodon.jp/2010-0917-1433-11/www.japantoday.com/category/crime/view/entertainer-tashiro-arrested-over-cocaine-possession Entertainer Tashiro arrested over cocaine possession]{{cite web|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2010/09/17/national/singer-tashiro-arrested-again-over-narcotics/#.VZ--qPntlBc|title=Singer Tashiro arrested again over narcotics |publisher=Search.japantimes.co.jp |date=2010-09-17 |accessdate=2013-01-04}}{{cite web|url=http://www.japan-zone.com/news/2010/09/16/tashiro_masashi_has_blown_it_again.shtml |title=Tashiro Masashi Has Blown It Again |publisher=Japan-zone.com |date=2006-10-29 |accessdate=2013-01-04}} Yokohama District Public [[Prosecutor#Japan|Prosecutors]]' Office indicted him on October 6, 2010.[https://news.yahoo.com/entertainer-tashiro-indicted-over-cocaine.html?nf=1 Entertainer Tashiro Indicted Over Cocaine] This incident outraged and disappointed his former co-workers and friends again, and many of them made comments publicly regarding this incident. His bandmate [[Masayuki Suzuki]] expressed his disappointment and frustration, stating "I have no idea what to say about this affair. I just wanted him to remember the very hard time not only his family and those around him but also that he himself has had. He really is a bonehead." [http://hochi.yomiuri.co.jp/feature/entertainment/topics/news/20100917-OHT1T00042.htm 鈴木雅之「本当に大バカ」志村けんもショック…田代容疑者５度目逮捕に落胆：芸能特集：スポーツ報知] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120110165713/http://hochi.yomiuri.co.jp/feature/entertainment/topics/news/20100917-OHT1T00042.htm |date=2012-01-10 }} (Japanese) Also, Torata Nanbu, leader of [[Tokyo Shock Boys]], one of the people had been supporting Tashiro for the sake of his comeback, said sadly "My heart is aching very much. I don't mean to beat him up, but he makes me feel empty inside. I wonder if the drug might be more fascinating for him than the feeling of returning to the entertainment industry, " and concluded, "I cannot take any more. Regrettably, this is the end. It is no longer possible for him to restore his reputation.[http://www.sponichi.co.jp/entertainment/news/2010/09/17/kiji/K20100917Z00000060.html 電撃ネットワーク南部虎弾「残念だけど終わり　復帰なんてもうない」 ― スポニチ Sponichi Annex 芸能] (Japanese)" He had been appearing in the radio program named "Tashiro Nakamura　Nanbu Akua-Chan", broadcast in Rainbowtown FM, aimed at supporting Tashiro's comeback, where nobody got paid even once before the programme was cancelled. ==Rehabilitation== Tashiro was released on Parole in July 20, 2014. Thereafter, he began his stay at DARC Jeanne (DARC stands for Drug Addiction Rehabilitation Center. Ironically, with Masashi Tashiro being known for his puns, the name of this Rehab Center is also a pun on [[Joan of Arc|Jeanne D'Arc]]). He appeared at a press conference on March 18, 2015, announcing the Opening of the Asagaya Loft A. There's a chance that Tashiro may want to return, but the entertainment industry may not take kindly to it. == Other suspicions of illegal video recording == Tashiro once hosted a combative sport program, [[Fuji Television]]'s ''SRS'', with actress [[Norika Fujiwara]]. It was later found out that he was warned many times by the staff, who became irritated with his habit of sneaking into the ladies' bathroom (possibly with camera equipment) and not emerging again for hours afterwards. Additionally, it was revealed that Fujiwara and other female television stars changed their clothes in the ladies' toilet during the time Tashiro was hiding inside. The staff associated with the show were suspicious that Tashiro did set up a small, transmitting [[camera]] in the toilet room.[http://www.hateruma.com/search_cult/search.cgi?word=%C6%A3%B8%B6%B5%AA%B9%E1 {{nihongo2|藤原紀香：カルト事件簿}}]{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} {{ja icon}} == Author == {{Expand section|date=January 2007}} In July 2002 he published a book, {{nihongo|"''Self-destruction -The Judgement Day-''"|自爆 -The Judgement Day-|Jibaku -The Judgement Day-}}, in which he talks about the scandal, his family, life in jail and his comeback to the entertainment world. He confessed to using amphetamines in the book, stating that his first drug use was in [[Hawaii]] in April 1998. However, he contradicted this statement when he said that "''I used amphetamines and [[cannabis (drug)|marijuana]] first in Hawaii in May 1991''" in a second trial on December 17, 2004. He also said that his first amphetamine use in Japan was in April, 2001. == "Person of the Year" incident== In 2001, users of [[internet forum]] [[2channel]] voted en-masse Tashiro as [[Time (magazine)|Time Magazine]]'s [[Time Person of the Year|Person of the Year]]. This act was soon dubbed the "Tashiro Festival" (''Tashiro Matsuri'', 田代祭) by 2ch users. 2channel programmers developed many scripts such as "Tashiro Cannon" (''Tashiro-hō'', 田代砲), "Mega particle Tashiro Cannon" (''Mega-ryūshi Tashiro-hō'', メガ粒子田代砲), "25 repeated blows Tashiro Cannon" (''Nijū-go renda Tashiro-hō'', 25連打田代砲) "Super Tashiro Cannon" (''Chō Tashiro-hō'', 超田代砲) to be able to vote repeatedly. "Super Tashiro cannon" was so powerful that it crashed Time's server. Afterwards, "Satellite Cannon -Tashiro-" was developed, but it was not deployed. Due to the votes of 2channel users, he got to the No. 1 position temporarily on December 21, 2001.
